title: Artist talk on Fuller, Bear Island
text:
Artist talk on Fuller, Bear Island Oct 02, 2015 Photo by: Sean O'Brien Sean O'Brien, caretaker of Bear Island, created an outdoor sculpture there based on the ideas of Buckminster Fuller. 
Camden — Artist Sean Patrick O’Brien will lead a presentation on Penobscot Bay’s Bear Island and how the coastal Maine island landscape helped shape the ideas and dymaxion designs of futurist R. Buckminster Fuller Tuesday, Oct. 13, at noon at Merryspring Nature Center, 30 Conway Road. 
O’Brien’s presentation will introduce the audience to Bear Island, a small private island located 10 miles from Camden in east Penobscot Bay .The talk will include a video exploring the island, explaining its nature and landscape and how they influenced the ideas of synergy, dymaxion design and the Spaceship Earth theory of renowned scientist, architect, designer and most famous island resident Fuller. 
Around the time of this presentation, a floating sculpture of O’Brien’s, based on dymaxion design principles, will be floating in Rockport Harbor. O’Brien is the caretaker of Bear Island and an artist whose work is influenced by Fuller’s geodesic forms and synergistic approach to the nature of the structure. He has a degree in degree in studio for interrelated media from the Massachusetts College of Art, where he created kinetic sculptures, interactive and experimental artwork. 
This talk is part of the Summer Talk Series at Merryspring, co-sponsored by Camden National Bank and Goodridge-Lermond Tree Service. Tuesday Talks are open to the public for $5, free for Merryspring members. 
Merryspring is a member-supported, nonprofit nature education center and park located just off Route 1 by the Hannaford shopping plaza. For more information, call Merryspring at 236-2239 or email info@merryspring.org .
